articles.title: Kim Jong Un Enjoys Extravaganza "Arirang"
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Enjoys Extravaganza "Arirang"
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader of the Workers' Party of Korea and people Marshal Kim Jong Un enjoyed mass gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang", winner of Kim Il Sung Prize, together with Pyongyangites on Sunday. 
					 Among the audience were senior officials of the party, state and army Choe Ryong Hae, Hyon Yong Chol and others, chairperson of a friendly party and officials of the party, armed forces and power bodies, social organizations, ministries and national institutions, service personnel of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, officials in the fields of science, education, literature and arts, public health and media, labor innovators and working people in Pyongyang. 
					
					 Present on invitation were overseas compatriots, the chief of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front, diplomatic envoys of various countries and representatives of international organizations and members of the foreign military attaches corps here and their spouses and foreign guests. 
					
					 The performance impressively made a grand epic representation of the past in which a definite end was put to the distress-torn history of the nation and the present of Songun Korea in which its dignity has been placed on the highest level thanks to the peerlessly great leaders and its eternal prosperity.
					
					 The extravaganza staged in vast three-dimensional space was a perfect combination of graceful and spectacular rhythms, dynamic gymnastics, refined artistic representation rich in national flavor, ever-changing background, gorgeous stage decor and peculiar lighting, etc. It clearly showcased the inexhaustible strength and skill of the Korean people and the rapid development of Juche arts.
					
					 At the end of the performance fireworks were displayed in succession, beautifully decorating the nocturnal sky of Pyongyang.
					
					 Kim Jong Un waved back to the enthusiastic cheers of the performers and audience and congratulated the former on their successful performance.
					
					 He expressed great satisfaction over the fact that "Arirang" was successfully re-represented in fresh style in reflection of the need of the developing era and the desire of the people. He extended thanks to the performers and creators. 
					
					 The performance "Arirang" made its debut in 2002 on the occasion of the 90th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung. The extravaganza staged more than 420 times over the last decade has been watched by at least 13 million service personnel, working people and youth and students and over 180 000 overseas compatriots and south Koreans and foreigners.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Inspects Various Places in Hoeryong City
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Inspects Various Places in Hoeryong City
						
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- Premier Choe Yong Rim, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, learned about the work of various sectors in Hoeryong City, North Hamgyong Province. 
					 Working people of factories and enterprises in Hoeryong City, whose appearance has changed beyond recognition under the great love of leader Kim Jong Il, have achieved successes in production and construction, true to the behests of President Kim Il Sung and the leadership of the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The premier learned about in detail the long-term plan of the city which will be spruced up and looked round various places including Kim Jong Suk Teacher Training College.
					
					 He discussed the measures for the operation of factories and enterprises which are conducive to supplying materials needed for sprucing up the city and improving the people's diet true to the behests of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He looked round the Jungbong Coal Mine.
					
					 The premier met miners and encouraged them to boost production, being aware that they are responsible for the lifeline of the national economy.
					
					 And the premier called at their houses to learn about their living.
					
					 A consultative meeting held on the spot underscored the need to discuss measures and ways for drastically increasing coal production.
					
					 Earlier, the premier learned about the work in the Rason Economic Trade Zone.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Turkmenistan
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Turkmenistan 
						
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Gurbanguly Berdymuhamedov, president of Turkmenistan, on Sept. 9.
					 The president in the message sent warm congratulations to Kim Jong Un on the occasion of the birthday of the DPRK, its national holiday, wishing him good health, happiness and safety and the Korean people peace, progress and prosperity.
					
					 He sent regards to Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Floral Baskets to DPRK Embassies from Foreign Figures, Political Parties and Organizations
articles.content:
Floral Baskets to DPRK Embassies from Foreign Figures, Political Parties and Organizations
						
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- Figures, political parties, organizations and institutions of different countries sent floral baskets to the DPRK embassies in their countries between September 6 and 12 on the occasion of the 64th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 Floral baskets sent by them were laid before full-length paintings and portraits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They included the foreign minister of Egypt, minister of State for Foreign Affairs of India, coordinator of the National Coordinating Committee of the Workers' Party of Mexico, foreign minister of Mexico, the National Executive Committee of the Workers' Party of Mexico, the People's Socialist Party of Mexico, the Socialist Popular Party of Mexico, the Socialist Party of Mexico, the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, the Mexican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Mexican Friend Association for Memory of President Kim Il Sung, the Mexican Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification and the Mexico-Korea Friendship Association.
					
					 29 organizations and institutions of Malaysia also sent floral baskets to the DPRK embassy in the country. They included the Youth Organization of the Malaysian Chinese Association, the Malaysia-Korea Friendship Association, the Malaysian Table Tennis Association and the M.K.P Company.

articles.title: Foreign Personages Pay Congratulatory Visits to DPRK Missions
articles.content:
Foreign Personages Pay Congratulatory Visits to DPRK Missions 
						
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- Personages of Bangladesh, Egypt and China paid visits to the DPRK missions in their countries on Sept. 9, the 64th anniversary of the DPRK. 
					 They laid floral baskets before full-length pictures and portraits of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and made bows. 
					
					 Among them were the minister of Industry of Bangladesh who is general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Bangladesh (Marxist-Leninist), chairman of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Bangladesh, chairman of the Central Executive Committee of the Bangladesh National Socialist Party, general secretary of the C.C., the Bangladesh Communist Party, chairman of the Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee, chairman of the Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy, secretary of the Chamberlain of the Presidency of Egypt, general managers of trade companies in Dandong, China and the family of Ri Min, who is related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle in China.

articles.title: Chinese Youth Friendship Delegation Goes Back
articles.content:
Chinese Youth Friendship Delegation Goes Back
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- The youth friendship delegation of China went back home on Monday.

articles.title: National Forum and Exhibition on City Management Held
articles.content:
National Forum, Exhibition on City Management Held 
						
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- A national scientific and technological forum and exhibition in the field of city management took place at the People's Palace of Culture here from Sept. 13 to 17.
					 This event was held on the occasions of the 50th anniversary of President Kim Il Sung's work "On Improving City Management" and the 20th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's work "Let's Further Improve City Management as Required by the Developing Reality".
					
					 It was attended by officials, scientists, technicians and working people from the city management field, educational institutions and scientific research institutes in different parts of the country.
					
					 The exhibition was held, divided into branches of building, water supply and drainage, air-conditioning, gardening and road and city beautification. Displayed there were more than 100 data in the form of real things, diagrams, etc. and presented there over 200 papers.
					
					 The following are the papers which came first in the event.
					
					- The way of increasing the rate of rooting by the tree active agent (Kim Il Sung University).
					
					- Anion building paints (Kim Chaek University of Technology).
					
					- Characteristics of the enclose-with-park plan for the modern district of the Pyongyang Folk Park and the test of reliability of skyscraping buildings built of reinforced concrete (Pyongyang University of Construction and Building-Materials Industry).
					
					- On study on introducing computer-observed and controlled system to sewage treatment plant (the city management institute under the State Academy of Sciences).
					
					- The water feeding pump based on the self-feeding system (the station for water supply and drainage of Taedonggang District).
					
					- Grass-cutter (the City Management Bureau of the Jagang Provincial People's Committee).

articles.title: Pyongyang Autumn International Trade Fair to Be Held
articles.content:
Pyongyang Autumn International Trade Fair to Be Held
						
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- The 8th Pyongyang Autumn International Trade Fair is to be held at the Three-Revolution Exhibition here from Sept. 24 to 27.
					 It will bring together more than 210 companies from the DPRK, China, Netherlands, Germany, Russia, Malaysia, Switzerland, UK, Australia, Italy, France, Poland and Taipei of China.
					
					 Displayed there will be at least 1 390 kinds of goods of different sectors including metal, machine, electricity, agriculture, light industry, public health and foodstuff and daily necessities. CNC machine tools manufactured by the DPRK will be included in the exhibits.
					
					 The fair will contribute to developing cooperation and exchange among countries and regions in the fields of trade, economy and science and technology.

articles.title: Pyongyang Int'l Film Festival to Be Held in DPRK
articles.content:
Int'l Film Festival to Be Held in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- The 13th Pyongyang International Film Festival will be opened on September 20.
					 Feature, documentary, short and children's films from different countries will be shown at theatres and cinemas in the city.
					
					 Directors, producers and critics from DPRK, China, Russia, Germany and Australia will sit on the jury.
					
					 The festival will be held, divided into competition and special and circular movies screening.
					
					 The DPRK presents to it the feature film "Wishes", documentary "Ogasan Natural Reserve" and cartoons "Pyol Nam and Rubber Ball" and "Kkamjang Loses the Way".
					
					 Also screened at the festival will be the DPRK-China co-produced movie "Meet in Pyongyang" and DPRK-Britain co-produced movie "Comrade Kim Goes Flying".
					
					 Film exchange meetings and a DPRK movie preview are scheduled in the festival.
					
					 The festival, which began in Juche 76 (1987), takes place every two years from 1990, in the idea of independence, peace and friendship.

articles.title: Preparations for Pyongyang Int'l Film Festival Finished
articles.content:
Preparations for Pyongyang Int'l Film Festival Finished
						
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- Preparations for the 13th Pyongyang International Film Festival, to be held on Sept. 20-27, have been finished amid deep interest of movie persons of different countries.
					 In this regard Choe Myong Hak, director of the Secretariat of the Festival Organizing Committee, told KCNA:
					
					 "The Committee always welcomes anyone hoping to take part in the festival.
					
					 The festival serves as an occasion to deepen friendship among the world's movie persons desirous of common prosperity and social progress and development of national movies and promote the global development of movies.
					
					 Pyongyang rounded off all preparations for the festival.
					
					 Venues for the festival were already selected, with translations and subtitles finished.
					
					 New festival-related publications were printed and posters are seen in streets,
					
					 The festival's opening and closing sessions are to be held ceremoniously and prizes and souvenirs are already ready.
					
					 Tourism is also expected in the festival days.

articles.title: All-round Maritime Conservation System Established in Nampho City
articles.content:
All-round Maritime Conservation System Established in Nampho City
						
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- The Democratic People's Republic of Korea has recently established an all-round maritime conservation system in Nampho City. This laid a scientific basis for environmental protection and sustained development of resources in the coastal area.
					 The government designated the city and its surroundings as a trial area in Juche 82 (1993) and set up a maritime conservation research centre equipped with scientific means for surveying and analyzing environment in this area of several hundred square kilometers, which covers the basin of the River Taedong in and around the city and waters down the West Sea Barrage.
					
					 Pak Ki Sok, director of the West Sea of Korea Marine Institute, told KCNA:
					
					 "We established a computer network connecting all scientific institutions and universities in the city to the centre. Then we worked out an all-round environmental monitoring plan and new evaluation methods while improving the ability of analyzing environment.
					
					 Scientists and technicians of the centre and other units have collected in a systematic way data on the environment in the trial area after establishing a comprehensive information management system.
					
					 The centre also built up its professional staff through reeducation and short courses at a maritime conservation scientists training centre set up at Kim Il Sung University.
					
					 Since 2007 the maritime environmental monitoring plan has been put into practice.
					
					 Meanwhile, we carried out the work to partition coastal and water areas according to the range of their use so as to raise their effectiveness in environmental conservation and resource development."

articles.title: Pak Kum Hyang, DPRK's Track Star
articles.content:
Pak Kum Hyang, DPRK's Track Star
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- Pak Kum Hyang, an athlete at the sports team of Pyongyang Jang Chol Gu University of Commerce, won a gold medal at the Chinese Taipei Track and Field Tournament held in last May.
					 She also took the title at the 3 000m hurdle race in the tournament held last year.
					
					 Born into a farmer's family in Kusong City, North Phyongan Province, she began her career as an athlete at a juvenile sports school at the age of 15. Two years later, she came under the spotlight of professionals.
					
					 She proved successful at a series of local tournaments, including the Mangyongdae Prize Sports Games and national championships, setting new national records four times.

articles.title: Ri Jo Won Wins in Ssirum Tournament
articles.content:
Ri Jo Won Wins in Ssirum Tournament
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- The 10th National Ssirum (Korean wrestling) Tournament for the Grand Bull Prize came to a close on Monday. It began on Rungna Islet here last Friday on the occasion of Chusok (Harvest Moon Festival).
					 Ri Jo Won, a student at Sinuiju University of Light Industry in North Phyongan Province, took the title at the open-category event in the tournament, becoming the winner for four consecutive years.
					
					 The open-category event brought together 20 wrestlers, in which the reigning champion defeated the opponents by fully displaying his special skills, belly grab and overturning.
					
					 Ri, who was awarded one-tonnage bull together with golden cowbell, told KCNA that he would defend his championship in the next tournament.
					
					 North Phyongan Province finished first, Pyongyang City second and Kangwon Province third in the team event.

articles.title: Typhoon-16 Affects DPRK
articles.content:
Typhoon-16 Affects DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- The east coastal area and some parts of Ryanggang, North and South Hwanghae provinces in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea have experienced strong wind and rainfall since this morning, affected by the typhoon-16.
					 It has rained in all areas of Kangwon Province, with winds of 10 to 13 meters per second in Kosong County and Kaesong City.
					
					 The typhoon, located at 34.9 degrees north latitude and 128 degrees east longitude at 12:00, is moving northward at a speed of 36 kilometers per hour.
					
					 With 965 hPa in the center, it has a maximum wind speed of 35 meters per second.

articles.title: Hostile Policies of Two U.S. Political Parties toward DPRK under Fire
articles.content:
Hostile Policies of Two U.S. Political Parties toward DPRK under Fire 
						
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- U.S. Republican presidential candidate Mitt Romney in his recent DPRK policy initiative blustered that if he is elected president in future, he will settle the "nuclear issue of north Korea" through harsh sanctions, blockade, isolation and pressure.
					 U.S. Democratic Party presidential candidate Obama in his political program accused the DPRK of steadily developing nukes and missile technology in disregard of its international commitment, threatening that the DPRK should take a cool option: it should either take steps for the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula in a verifiable manner or pay a price for failing to do so.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 What the presidential candidates from the two reactionary parties cried out was prompted by their common objectives. 
					
					 They said so because the Obama administration and its preceding governments experienced setbacks in their hostile policies toward the DPRK.
					
					 Romney, instead of drawing a lesson from this, foolishly sought to mislead public opinion by creating impression that if the sanctions and blockade against the DPRK were tightened to garner votes in the forthcoming election, this would help force it to dismantle its nukes. 
					
					 The above-mentioned outbursts prove that the U.S. politicians share the political thinking that the U.S. should tighten the alliance with Japan and the south Korean puppet regime, build a missile shield in East Asia and thus contain its neighboring countries by force of arms by reinforcing the justification for carrying out its strategy of attaching importance to Asia-Pacific under the pretext of the DPRK's "provocations" and "threat of nuclear development".
					
					 The two parties' announcement of their hard-line policies toward the DPRK would make the prospect of settling the nuclear issue dimmer.
					
					 The issue can never be resolved through such isolation, moves for suffocation, sanctions and blockade against the DPRK.
					
					 Everything depends on the U.S. withdrawal of its hostile policy toward the DPRK and the removal of its nuclear threat.
					
					 The U.S. authorities would be well advised to drop such miscalculation.

articles.title: To Punish Lee Myung Bak Regime Is Just Option of Korean People: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
To Punish Lee Myung Bak Regime Is Just Option of Korean People: Rodong Sinmun
						
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- The sacred war for reunifying the country is the only  just option chosen by the DPRK for coping with south Korea's Lee Myung Bak regime of traitors that plunged the north-south relations into complete deadlock and brought the danger of war to the Korean Peninsula.
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday says this in a bylined article.
					
					 The DPRK has constantly looked for ways for dialogue and cooperation even at a time when the north-south standoff has become serious due to the emergence of the present puppet regime in south Korea, says the article, adding:
					
					 The DPRK's stand stemmed from its view that the north and the south are the same nation and should pool their efforts for reunification.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak regime, seized by a pipe dream of "contingency", leveled the gun at its fellow countrymen who were grieving over the greatest loss and made such hideous provocations as insulting the dignity of the supreme leadership one after another. It went the lengths of plotting a politically-oriented terrorism unprecedented in history, just like a declaration of war against the DPRK.
					
					 There is no other option but to deal a merciless blow with arms to the confrontation maniacs bereft of reasons -- this is the last conclusion the DPRK has drawn from the ruling period of the Lee's conservative group.
					
					 In order to ensure durable peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula, it is necessary to remove the sources of war.
					
					 It is the steadfast will of the DPRK to reunify the country by severely punishing the warmongers who are going reckless under a scenario for mounting a preemptive attack on the DPRK and thus ensure durable peace and stability on the peninsula.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK are awaiting the last order for fighting a great war for reunifying the country.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams Lee Myung Bak's Anti-DPRK Remarks
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams Lee Myung Bak's Anti-DPRK Remarks 
						
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, traitor Lee Myung Bak of south Korea, when meeting the U.S. secretary of State on the sidelines of the summit of the Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation held in Russia, cried out for "close cooperation" among south Korea, the U.S. and Japan while pressing for a "solution to the nuclear issue of the north".
					 A few days afterward, the traitor visited Norway and held a joint briefing where he let loose a spate of provocative vituperation that only the "military way will not help solve the problem", while pulling up the DPRK over issues of "denuclearization and improvement of human rights".
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday says in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 This is the last-ditch act of those who are in dilemma owing to the total bankruptcy of their confrontation policy.
					
					 Traitor Lee Myung Bak has relied on outside forces to put a brake on the DPRK's efforts for bolstering up its nuclear deterrent for self-defense. This is just a ridiculous act.
					
					 The nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula was produced as the U.S. shipped nuclear weapons into south Korea and posed a threat to the DPRK with nukes.
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces are becoming all the more reckless in their moves to invade the DPRK.
					
					 It is entirely just that the DPRK bolstered the nuclear deterrent for self-defense under the uplifted banner of Songun to cope with the prevailing situation and no one can find fault with it.
					
					 If the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces persist in their hostile acts for provocation and aggression aimed at the DPRK, its nuclear deterrent for self-defense will be further modernized and expanded.
					
					 No one will lend an ear to the rubbish of lunatic Lee Myung Bak whose days are numbered.
					
					 He had better stop his absurd wordplay and get ready for his death.

articles.title: DPRK-Japan Relations Hinge on Japan's Attitude: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
DPRK-Japan Relations Hinge on Japan's Attitude: KCNA Commentary
						
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- 10 years have passed since the DPRK-Japan Pyongyang Declaration was adopted.
					 On September 17, 2002, the top leaders of the DPRK and Japan signed the declaration the main spirit of which is to redeem the inglorious past between the two countries, settle their pending issues and establish fruitful political, economic and cultural relations for the first time in history.
					
					 The DPRK-Japan Pyongyang Declaration serves as a milestone for improving the DPRK-Japan relations as it comprehensively indicates the goal, principles and basic ways for doing so.
					
					 The declaration reflects the will of the peoples of the two countries to create a new history of the improved DPRK-Japan relations by liquidating the inglorious past, banning any act of threatening mutual security and cooperating with each other for peace and stability in Northeast Asia.
					
					 The government of the DPRK has made every possible effort for successfully implementing the declaration.
					
					 Quite contrary to this, Japan misinterpreted and defamed the basic spirit of the declaration from the outset, scuttling the implementation of its every paragraph.
					
					 Zealously pursuant to the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK, Japan has not implemented any provision of the declaration but worked in the direction of annulling it.
					
					 Japan embellished and justified its history of aggression against Korea in which it imposed unspeakable misfortune and sufferings upon the Korean people including the sexual slavery, violating the provisions calling for redeeming its past crimes, the basic requirement for the implementation of the declaration and prerequisite to the improvement of the DPRK-Japan relations.
					
					 Persistently pulling up the DPRK over "its nuclear and missile and abduction issues," Japan fanned up the hostility toward the DPRK and stepped up the moves for its militarist expansion in real earnest internally and turned the DPRK-Japan relations more hostile than those before the adoption of the declaration.
					
					 It was the view of Japan that the settlement of the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula and detente are little short of losing the justification for putting into practice its moves for turning itself into a military giant including nuclear weaponization.
					
					 That was why Japan threw obstacles in discussing every matter at the six-party talks for the settlement of the nuclear issue on the peninsula.
					
					 The "missile issue" touted by Japan is nothing but a pretext for rounding off its preparations for turning itself into a military giant and staging a comeback to Korea as evidenced by its joint efforts with the U.S. to establish the missile defence system and launch spy satellites under the pretext of ensuring peace and security in Northeast Asia.
					
					 This is clearly proved by the fact that Japan recently laid a legal foundation for its space militarization and nuclear weaponization, talking about the DPRK's "missile threat".
					
					 The forces of Japan hostile to the DPRK are persistently raising the already settled "abduction issue" and using it for their sinister political purposes.
					
					 Japan has persistently concocted fresh "information about abduction" though the "abduction issue" had been finally settled thanks to the sincere efforts made by the DPRK. It has used this as a principal pretext for concealing its past crimes. 
					
					 Japan created "abduction industry" rare to be found in any other parts of the world. It set up government organizations and conspiratorial bodies handling the "abduction issue" in various places, using them as a lever for winning the popularity of conservative politicians and letting those who deal with the issue earn money. 
					
					 Only when one raises a hue and cry over the "abduction issue", can one become "a nationalist" and "a patriot" and do a bit in the political camp. Only ruckus over this matter can help such riff-raffs as the members of "the Society for Rescuing Abductees" eke out their living. This is the present situation of Japan.
					
					 The Japanese authorities have intensified their political persecution and suppression of Koreans in Japan and the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), a legitimate overseas citizens' organization of the DPRK under the pretext of the "abduction issue", mercilessly infringing upon their right to existence and national rights. Their repressive campaign against Koreans in Japan and Chongryon protecting their national rights has reached its height.
					
					 As all facts prove, the Japanese authorities' racket over the "nuclear, missile and abduction issues" pursuant to the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK is nothing but a wanton violation of the DPRK-Japan Pyongyang Declaration and a move to scrap it. 
					
					 Due to Japan's vicious policy of confrontation with the DPRK, the declaration has been seriously misinterpreted as the one for settling someone's "nuclear, missile and abduction issues" quite contrary to its noble idea and spirit and the prospect of its implementation is becoming grim as the days go by. 
					
					 The DPRK-Japan relations can never be mended if Japan persistently talks about the "nuclear, missile and abduction issues," toeing the U.S. policy, failing to realize the gravity of the prevailing situation.
					
					 It is the behest of Generalissimo Kim Jong Il to improve the DPRK-Japan relations so that the two countries may become near and close countries, not near but distant ones.
					
					 The government of the DPRK remains unchanged in its stand to implement the DPRK-Japan Pyongyang Declaration to the last.
					
					 If the Japanese authorities are truly willing to contribute to the development of the relations between the two countries and peoples and peace and stability in the region, they should roll back their anachronistic hostile policy toward the DPRK and opt for the implementation of the historic declaration.
					
					 Whether the DPRK-Japan relations are normalized in conformity with the expectation of the international community and the wishes of the peoples of the two countries in the new century or remain in the abnormal state of confrontation entirely depends on Japan's attitude.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Lambastes Lee Myung Bak for Begging for "Cooperation" over Nuclear Issue
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Lambastes Lee Myung Bak for Begging for "Cooperation" over Nuclear Issue
						
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- Traitor Lee Myung Bak of south Korea is letting loose a spate of vituperation against the DPRK in a bid to beg other countries for "cooperation" in his racket over its nuclear issue.
					 Shortly ago, Lee met heads of state of foreign countries attending the APEC summit and implored them to "cooperate" with south Korea in the settlement of the "nuclear issue of the north". Not content with this, he flew to a Nordic country where he again trumpeted about "no nukes and opening", claiming that "if the north abandons its nukes and become a member of the international community, the whole world will help it".
					
					 Great irony is that Lee is behaving so foolishly though he is no more than a sleep walker hit hard from all sides, totally rejected by the people and strongly censured at home and abroad.
					
					 The disgusting remarks made by Lee, ignorant of the essence of the nuclear issue, are no more than the last-ditch efforts of those driven into a tight corner due to the total failure of his policy of confrontation with the north.
					
					 The nuclear issue of the Korean Peninsula was spawned by the U.S. nuclear threat to the DPRK and the south Korean puppet group's toeing the U.S. line from A to Z. The U.S. ceaseless nuclear blackmail, deployment of nuclear weapons in south Korea and the reckless maneuvers for a nuclear war staged by it together with south Korean warmongers compelled the DPRK to have access to nuclear deterrent for self-defense.
					
					 Lee has neither justification nor face to talk about the nuclear issue as he has got frantic with those war exercises while dreaming of disarming the DPRK and "bringing down its social system" with the watchwords of "no nukes, opening and 3 000 dollars" since he seized power.
					
					 In recent days alone he introduced a lot of nuclear war hardware for carrying out the U.S. new defense strategy and kicked up a new racket for a nuclear war such as Ulji Freedom Guardian only to be denounced for acting as a shock brigade and main servant for a nuclear war and straining the situation in the Korean Peninsula and the region.
					
					 As disclosed by a south Korean opposition party on Sept. 10, it is none other than Lee Myung Bak who is so serious about turning the Jeju naval base into a nuclear carrier base of the U.S. forces.
					
					 No wonder, foreign experts at a recent meeting ridiculed the south Korean puppet regime, questioning its delegates "until when it would be under the U.S. nuclear umbrella". "South Korea will not escape second-category treatment as long as it behaves so", they added.
					
					 Lee had better shut up his mouth causing only misfortune and dig out his grave rather than suffering disgrace for ridiculously imploring for such "cooperation."

articles.title: S. Koreans Condemn U.S. Military Exercises
articles.content:
S. Koreans Condemn U.S. Military Exercises
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- Civil, social and youth and students bodies of south Korea held the 156th rally for actions for independent reunification and peace before the U.S. embassy in Seoul on Sept. 11 denouncing the U.S. for rounding off preparations for a war of aggression and imposing only misfortune and sufferings upon fellow countrymen.
					 They condemned the U.S. troops for staging war drills to invade the north in Maehyang-ri for decades, thus jeopardizing the life of the inhabitants there.
					
					 They noted that the inhabitants were spending painful days, with them deprived of their cradle of life by the U.S. which has expanded its Phyongthaek military base under its new aggression doctrine.
					
					 They called for making efforts to take back their cradle of life.

articles.title: Foreigners Praise Extravaganza "Arirang"
articles.content:
Foreigners Praise Extravaganza "Arirang"
						
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- After enjoying mass gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang", foreigners expressed their excited feelings.
					 A member of the Vietnamese government economic delegation said that the performance was, in deed, fantastic, adding he saw the Korean people rallied close around their leader.
					
					 Dermot Hudson, chairman of the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, noted that he saw fantastic artistic and mysterious scenes. Many performers present perfect ensemble, he said, adding ever-changing background scenes took him by surprise.
					
					 Capitalist society does not dare to stage such performance, he said, adding that he got unforgettable impression.
					
					 Anatoli Dolgachev, chairman of the Far Eastern Association for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism of Russia, said that every scene of the performance led him to the wonder land.
					
					 Performers showed fantastic scenes, he said, adding this helped him come to know well about the might of the single-minded unity of the DPRK.
					
					 Igor Jurisic, head of the delegation for the study of the Juche idea of Slovenia, said:
					
					 Gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang" is the masterpiece representing the culture and art of mankind. This is flawless.
					
					 It was fortunate for him to enjoy such wonderful performance, he stressed.
					
					 Alhassan Mamman Muhammad, chairman of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, said that the arts of the DPRK have reached a high stage. He deeply felt how powerful the strength of the Korean people is, he added.
					
					 A member of the delegation of the Mongolian Mt. Paektu Association for Independent Development said that the Koreans are  great people with marvelous strength, wishing them greater success in their efforts to build a thriving nation.

articles.title: Vietnamese Paper on Impression of Visit to DPRK
articles.content:
Vietnamese Paper on Impression of Visit to DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- The Vietnamese paper Nhan Dan on September 9 carried a travelogue of its delegation's visit to the DPRK under the title "Impression of the DPRK" with a panoramic photo of Pyongyang.
					 The travelogue said:
					
					 We got deep impression through our visit to the DPRK.
					
					 The delegation visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill, laid bouquets before them and visited Mangyongdae, birthplace of the President.
					
					 A great number of people visit the statues on Mansu Hill in the centre of Pyongyang every day and lay floral baskets and bouquets before them.
					
					 Historic relics showing the revolutionary career of the President are preserved intact in Mangyongdae.
					
					 Visiting the Tower of the Juche Idea, Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum, Grand People's Study House, etc., the delegation got to know better about the achievements made by the Korean people under the leadership of the President.
					
					 The Juche idea founded by him has been successfully inherited and brilliantly embodied in defending the country and building socialism by the leaders of the DPRK.
					
					 Lots of service personnel and people from all walks of life are more firmly arming themselves with the revolutionary idea, looking round the Tower of the Juche Idea.
					
					 Right across the River Taedong there are Kim Il Sung Square and the Grand People's Study House.
					
					 The Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm vividly shows the signal achievements performed by the DPRK in the agricultural field.
					
					 Though it is suffering adversity in the field of the economy due to the sanctions and blockade, its people are dynamically advancing along the road of socialism under the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 The tour of the Three Charters for National Reunification Memorial Tower helped us know better about the ardent wish of the Korean people for the country's reunification.
					
					 Despite the hostile forces' moves to stifle the DPRK, its people are making strenuous efforts to protect the sovereignty of the country.

articles.title: Bangladesh Party Leader Urges U.S. to Withdraw Its Troops from S. Korea
articles.content:
Bangladesh Party Leader Urges U.S. to Withdraw Its Troops from S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- Mujahidul Islam Selim, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Bangladesh Communist Party, made public a statement on Sept. 10 in demand of the withdrawal of the U.S. troops from south Korea. 
					 In the statement he said as follows:
					
					 67 years have passed since the U.S. troops militarily occupied south Korea. 
					
					 The U.S. is the chieftain that separated the Korean nation into two and imposed upon them intolerable misfortune and sufferings for a long time. 
					
					 Had the U.S. troops not occupied south Korea, the Korean nation would have opened up the way of prosperity in a reunified country. 
					
					 The U.S. should not turn down the demand of the era and mind of the world people but withdraw its troops from south Korea at an early date. 
					
					 We will always extend support and solidarity to the principled stand of the party and government of the DPRK to head off war and protect peace.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Carried by Ugandan Paper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Carried by Ugandan Paper 
						
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- The Ugandan newspaper Sun Rise on Sept. 9 carried the detailed gist of the dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Effect Kim Jong Il's Patriotism and Step Up the Building of a Prosperous Country".
					 The work, published on July 26, 2012, clarifies the essence of     Kim Jong Il's patriotism and his whole life characterized by his noble love for the country and its people.
					
					 It also expounds important issues arising in embodying Kim Jong Il's patriotism.

articles.title: DPRK's Birthday Marked Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's Birthday Marked Abroad 
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- Lectures were given in Guinea, Sweden and Indonesia from Sept. 6 to 8 to mark the 64th anniversary of the DPRK. 
					 Secouna Camara, director general of the Kim Il Sung Institute of Agricultural Science in Guinea, said in his lecture that the foundation of the DPRK was the historic event which paved the way for building a powerful socialist state in Korea. A lot of people of the world envy the DPRK as a country where people's wellbeing is on the increase, tax-free country, country of free education and country of arts, he added. 
					
					 The chief of a Guinean press group said that President Kim Il Sung fathered the Songun idea to protect dignity of the country and the nation and made Korea a world-level political and military power. 
					
					 Now Marshal Kim Jong Un, another great general who is identical to Kim Il Sung, is successfully carrying forward the cause of the preceding leaders, he stressed. 
					
					 Oskar Molleby, chief of the Swedish Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, praised the DPRK for having vigorously advanced along the way of independence and Songun under the leadership of the peerlessly great men. 
					
					 He said supreme leader Kim Jong Un is leading the DPRK, expressing belief that it will shine long as a powerful country of independence.

articles.title: Meeting for Promoting Normalization of Japan-DPRK Diplomatic Relations Held
articles.content:
Meeting for Promoting Normalization of Japan-DPRK Diplomatic Relations Held
						
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- The second regular meeting of the Kanagawa Prefectural Citizen's Society for Promoting the Normalization of Japan-DPRK Diplomatic Relations was held at Yokohama City on Sept. 8 to mark the 10th anniversary of the DPRK-Japan Pyongyang Declaration.
					 Present there were personages from all walks of life and citizens in Kanagawa Prefecture.
					
					 Speeches were made at the meeting.
					
					 Prof. Narihiko Ito of a university of Japan said that the way is not found for a fundamental solution to improving the relations between the two countries until today, the 10th anniversary of the Japan-DPRK Pyongyang Declaration. He called upon the Society to expand the activities for normalizing the Japan-DPRK diplomatic relations.
					
					 The secretary general of the Kanagawa Prefectural Peace Movement Centre said that about seven decades have passed since the end of World War II, but Japan still refuses to make an apology and reparation to Asian countries. This is a fundamental thing that poses a threat to peace and stability in the region, he added.
					
					 Akihiro Harada, co-representative of the Kanagawa Prefectural Citizen's Society for Promoting the Normalization of Japan-DPRK Diplomatic Relation, and others expressed their impressions of what they had seen in the DPRK.

articles.title: Japan Censured for Laying Claim on Tok Islets
articles.content:
Japan Censured for Laying Claim on Tok Islets
						
Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- The Media Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing June 15 Joint Declaration made public a statement on Sept. 12. 
					The statement denounced Japan for running amuck to grab Tok Islets and the U.S. for patronizing it.
					
					It said the Japanese government has run ads in newspapers from Sept. 11 in the name of the Foreign Ministry, asserting Tok Islets are Japan's territory.
					
					Japan put ads titled "Tok Islets are inviolable land of Japan from a historical point of view and in light of international law" in about 70 papers of central and local areas and this campaign lasted a week, the statement said, and went on:
					
					This propaganda was aimed to negate the historical fact that Tok Islets belong to Korea and to evade the responsibility for the past crimes interwoven with aggression.
					
					The U.S. is a conspirator that shelters Japan as regards the matter of Tok Islets.
					
					This is part of the U.S. strategy for holding world hegemony to win south Korea together with Japan and form the military alliance for aggression.
					
					The statement demanded Japan stop false ad campaign and apologize for its past crimes.
					
					It also said the U.S. had better make an apology for its shameless moves concerning the issue of Tok Islets before the international community.

articles.title: Russia Blames Election System in U.S.
articles.content:
Russia Blames Election System in U.S.
 Moscow, September 16 (KCNA) -- The chairman of the Russian Central Election Commission vehemently castigated the election system in the U.S. some days ago.
					 Calling the elections in the U.S. the worst ones, he cited the fact 17 of all the U.S. successive presidents were elected without gaining majority of the affirmative votes.
					
					 This being a hard fact, the U.S. does not try to improve its election system and its talk about democracy is infuriating the people, he added.
					
					 He said he was always shocked by the U.S. brazen-faced, rude and stubborn attempt of trying to teach others its view of value on democracy.

articles.title: Iran Wants U.S. Apology for Profanity against Islam
articles.content:
Iran Wants U.S. Apology for Profanity against Islam
						
 Tehran, September 16 (KCNA) -- Iranian Foreign Ministry spokesman on Sept. 12 condemned U.S. for its profanity against Islamism.
					 He expressed frustration that Washington hadn't come out with a public criticism of a film seen as insulting to Islam.
					
					 "The Islamic Republic ... stresses that the systematic and continuous silence of the U.S. administration  is the main factor for the continuation of such moves," he was quoted by the semiofficial Fars News Agency as saying.
					
					 Stressing that the U.S. administration is obliged to curb such an insult to Islamism, he demanded immediate end of anti-Islamist film shows.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un presencia la funcion gimnastico-artistica masiva "Arirang"
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un presencia la funcion gimnastico-artistica masiva "Arirang"
						
Pyongyang, 17 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Maximo Dirigente del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y el pueblo coreano vio el dia 16 junto con los capitalinos la funcion gimnastico-artistica masiva "Arirang", obra laureada con el Premio Kim Il Sung.
					Le acompanaron en verla los cuadros directivos del partido, el Estado y el ejercito: Choe Ryong Hae, Hyon Yong Chol, etc., el presidente del partido amigo, los funcionarios de las instituciones del partido, las fuerzas armadas y el Poder, las entidades de masas, ministerios y organos centrales, los oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea y del Ejercito de Seguridad Interior del Pueblo de Corea, los funcionarios de sectores de ciencia, educacion, literatura y arte, salud publica, prensa e informacion, innovadores laborales y otros trabajadores capitalinos.
					
					Fueron invitados los coreanos en ultramar, el representante de la sucursal del Frente Democratico Nacional Antiimperialista, los representantes diplomaticos y los delegados de las organizaciones internacionales, acreditados en Corea, los agregados militares y sus esposas asi como los huespedes extranjeros.
					
					La funcion demostro con gran emocion a traves de los cuadros epicos el ayer, hoy y manana eternamente prospera de Corea del Juche que gracias a los eminentes Lideres, puso punto final a la historia accidentada de la nacion y elevo su dignidad a la cima.
					
					El espectaculo, que armoniza perfectamente el ritmo hermoso y elegante que se desarrolla en el gran espacio tridimensional con la gimnasia anima, el matiz nacional con la aprobada representacion artistica, la pizarra humana de mil formas y la decoracion escenica con la iluminacion, demostro vividamente la inagotable fuerza y el talento del pueblo coreano y el aspecto del arte jucheano en desarrollo.
					
					Terminada la funcion, se tiraron las salvas al cielo nocturno de la capital.
					
					El Maximo Dirigente respondio a las aclamaciones de los ejecutantes y espectadores y felicito el exito de la funcion.
					
					Se mostro muy satisfecho de que la funcion haya representado bien la demanda de la epoca en desarrollo y la aspiracion del pueblo y dio agradecimiento a los ejecutantes y creadores.
					
					Durante los 10 anos desde  cuando ofrecio en 2002 su primera funcion con motivo del 90o aniversario del natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung hasta la fecha, la "Arirang" se realizo en mas de 420 ocasiones y la vieron mas de 13 millones de militares del EPC, trabajadores de distintos estratos, jovenes y ninos escolares y mas de 180 mil coreanos en ultramar, surcoreanos y extranjeros.

articles.title: Premier coreano dirige trabajo de varias ramas de Hoeryong
articles.content:
Premier coreano dirige trabajo de varias ramas de Hoeryong
						
Pyongyang, 17 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El premier Choe Yong Rim, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, averiguo sobre el terreno las labores de varios dominios de la ciudad de Hoeryong de la provincia de Hamgyong del Norte.
					Los obreros de fabricas y empresas de esa ciudad, cuya fisonomia fue cambiada totalmente gracias al beneficio del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, logran exitos en la produccion y construccion con la unica decision de materializar el legado de Kim Jong Il y apoyar bien la guia del Mariscal Kim Jong Un.
					
					Ante todo, el premier se entero en detalles del plan perspectivo de la ciudad de Hoeryong a levantarse con mas excelencia y recorrio varios puntos inclusive el Instituto Superior Normal      Kim Jong Suk.
					
					Discutio las medidas pendientes que se presentan en la gestion de las fabricas y empresas que contribuyen a suministrar los materiales necesarios a acondicionar la ciudad y mejorar la calidad de vida alimentaria del pueblo en acato al legado de       Kim Jong Il.
					
					Seguidamente, visito la mina carbonifera Jungbong.
					
					Estimulo a los mineros para que conscientes de encargarse de linea sanguinea de la economia nacional, libren un combate tenaz de produccion y cercioro tambien la vida de sus familias.
					
					En la reunion de consulta convocada en el terreno, se tomaron medidas y remedios para incrementar decisivamente la produccion carbonifera.
					
					Con anterioridad, el premier analizo tambien las labores en la zona economica y comercial de Rason.

articles.title: Mejora de relaciones Corea-Japon depende de actitud de Segundo
articles.content:
Mejora de relaciones Corea-Japon depende de actitud de segundo
						
Pyongyang, 17 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Han transcurrido 10 anos desde cuando fue aprobada la Declaracion de Pyongyang Corea-Japon.
					El 17 de septiembre de 2002 los lideres de Corea y Japon firmaron por primera vez en la historia la Declaracion de Pyongyang Corea-Japon, cuyo espiritu fundamental es liquidar el desagradable pasado entre los dos paises, resolver los problemas pendientes y establecer las fructuosas relaciones politicas, economicas y culturales.
					
					Esta declaracion es el jalon para el mejoramiento de las relaciones entre estos dos paises, que aclaro  generalmente la meta, el principio y los medios fundamentales para el particular.
					
					Tambien refleja la voluntad de los pueblos de los dos paises de crear la nueva historia del mejoramiento de las relaciones al liquidar el deshonroso pasado, prohibir las acciones  amenazantes a la seguridad mutua y cooperar mutuamente por la paz y la estabilidad del Nordeste Asiatico.
					
					El gobierno de la RPDC hizo todos los esfuerzos posibles por la ejecucion exitosa de esta declaracion.
					
					Pero, desde el principio, Japon frustro la ejecucion de todos los articulos tergiversando e insultando el espiritu fundamental del documento.
					
					Al adherirse a la politica hostil anti-RPDC de EE.UU., no ejecuto ni uno de los articulos de la declaracion y los invalido.
					
					Al embellecer y justificar la historia de agresion a Corea que impuso incontables desgracias y dolores al pueblo coreano incluyendo el crimen de las esclavas sexuales para el viejo ejercito japones, este pais isleno quebranto el articulo de la liquidacion del pasado criminal, fundamento de la ejecucion de la declaracion y la condicion previa del mejoramiento de las relaciones con Corea.
					
					Al acusar obstinadamente a la RPDC de "problema de armas nucleares, misiles y secuestros" incito en su territorio nacional la hostilidad anti-RPDC e impulso activamente las maquinaciones de expansion militarista, asi como convirtio las relaciones bilaterales en las hostiles mas peores que antes de la aprobacion de la declaracion.
					
					Si se resuelve el problema nuclear de la Peninsula Coreana y se alivia la situacion de esta, Japon perdera el pretexto de la realizacion de la potencia militar incluyendo el armamento nuclear.
					
					Por lo tanto, el pais isleno puso obstaculos uno por uno en las conversaciones a 6 bandas por la resolucion del problema nuclear de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					El "problema de misiles" de que habla Japon, no pasa de ser un pretexto de establecer junto con EE.UU. el sistema antimisiles y lanzar el satelite espia bajo el rotulo de asegurar la paz y la estabilidad del Nordeste Asiatico y ademas, completar los preparativos por la conversion de su pais en la potencia militar y por la reagresion a Corea.
					
					Su ejemplo fehaciente es que recientemente, Japon asento una base legal por la militarizacion espacial y el armamento nuclear pretextando la "amenaza de misiles" de la RPDC.
					
					Las fuerzas hostiles anti-RPDC de Japon usan en el malsano proposito politico el "problema de secuestro" resuelto ya gracias a los esfuerzos sinceros del gobierno de la RPDC.
					
					Pero, ellas inventaron de continuo los nuevos "datos de secuestro" y los usaron para ocultar el crimen del pasado.
					
					Establecieron por doquier el aparato  gubernamental y otros intrigantes que tratan el "problema de secuestro" y los utilizaron como mecanismos para elevar la popularidad de los politiqueros conservadores y como medios para ganar dinero para quienes trabajan en estas esferas, de manera que produjeron la "industria de secuestro" nunca vista en todo el mundo.
					
					La realidad de Japon de hoy es que cuando unos parlotean del "problema de secuestro" pueden ser "nacionalistas" y "patriotas" y mantener la vida los fulanos de la "Sociedad para salvar a secuestros".
					
					Bajo el pretexto de tal problema, las autoridades japonesas perpetraron brutalmente la persecucion politica y la represion a los coreanos residentes en Japon y la Chongryon (Asociacion General de Coreanos Residentes en Japon), entidad legal de ciudadanos en ultramar de la RPDC, y violaron despiadadamente los derechos a la existencia y los nacionales.
					
					Como muestran los hechos, el alboroto de "armas nucleares, misiles y secuestro" de las autoridades japonesas adheridas a la politica hostil anti-RPDC de EE.UU. es el acto violador y destructor de la declaracion arriba mencionada por el desarrollo de las relaciones bilaterales y el aseguramiento de la paz y la seguridad del Nordeste Asiatico.
					
					Debido a la brutal politica y maniobras  conflictivas de Japon la Declaracion de Pyongyang Corea-Japon se ha venido tergiversando gravemente como si fuera un documento para  solucionar el "problema de armas nucleares, misiles y secuestro" en contrapelo de su noble ideal y espiritu y cada dia mas se ha hecho lejana la solucion de esta declaracion.
					
					Si Japon apela de continuo al "problema de armas nucleares,  misiles y secuestro" en adhesion a EE.UU. sin comprender la gravedad de la situacion creada, las relaciones con Corea no se podran mejorar.
					
					Convertir las relaciones entre la RPDC y Japon en las que estos dos paises sean los vecinos y cercanos no en los lejanos aunque estan situados cerca, mediante la mejora de las relaciones RPDC-Japon esto es el legado del Generalisimo de Kim Jong Il. 
					
					Es invariable la posicion del gobierno de la RPDC de ejecutar hasta el fin la Declaracion de Pyongyang Corea-Japon.
					
					Si las autoridades japonesas tienen de veras la voluntad de contribuir al desarrollo de las relaciones entre los dos paises y los pueblos y la paz y la estabilidad de la region, deben abandonar su anacronica politica hostil anti-RPDC y ejecutar la historica Declaracion de Pyongyang Corea-Japon.
					
					Mejorar las relaciones Corea-Japon conforme a la esperanza de la sociedad internacional del nuevo siglo y los pueblos de los dos paises, depende enteramente de la actitud de Japon.

articles.title: Establecido en Nampho sistema de control general de costeras
articles.content:
Establecido en Nampho sistema de control general de costeras
						
Pyongyang, 17 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Recientemente, quedo establecido en la ciudad de Nampho de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea el sistema de control general de costeras, gracias a lo cual se ha preparado la base cientifica capaz de proteger el medioambiente en la zona ejemplar nacional de centenares de kilometros cuadros que abarca la ciudad de Nampho y la cuenca del rio Taedong de su contorno y aguas maritimas del corriente abajo del Complejo Hidraulico del Mar Oeste y realizar el desarrollo sostenible de los recursos litorales.
					Despues de quedarse fijada en 1993 la zona ejemplar nacional, la ciudad de Nampho dispuso de todos los medios de investigacion cientifica para vigilar, medir y analizar el medioambiente de la citada zona.
					
					Pak Ki Sok (73 anos de edad), director del Instituto Maritimo del Mar Oeste, dijo a la ACNC que todas las instituciones de investigacion cientifica y las universidades de la ciudad estan conectadas por via de network tomando como base el centro de estudio de control de costeras acondicionado en el instituto, y prosiguio:
					
					El instituto establecio los planes de observacion general del medioambiente y las maneras de su evaluacion y ademas ha mejorado la capacidad de analisis del medioambiente.
					
					Despues de establecer el sistema de administracion general de informaciones, los cientificos y tecnicos del centro arriba mencionado y otras unidades coleccionaron de manera sistematica el estado medioambiental y los datos de la zona. 
					
					Ha incrementado la fila de los especialistas al ejecutar normalmente la reeducacion y la formacion de los especialistas tomando vinculo con el centro de formacion de especialistas de la administracion general de costeras nacionales de la Universidad Kim Il Sung.
					
					Desde 2007, el instituto lleva a efecto el plan de observacion general de ambiente de costeras a base del establecimiento de sistema de control general de costeras a que incluyen la administracion del medioambiente y el desarrollo de recursos de la zona.
					
					Elevo la eficacia en la administracion del ambiente, la exploracion y el uso de los recursos al ejecutar la labor de demarcar segun utilidades las costeras y zonas maritimas.
